docs.text: My name is Mike Moran and this is a repository of my code snippets and projects I'm working on.
docs.title: About

docs.text:
These are my 'quick setup' notes for getting a fresh pi up and running


Raspberry Pi Quick Setup:




Download 
Noobs


Download 
SD Card Formatter


Format SD Card (Don't use quick option), no Volume needed


Extract Noobs zip and copy contents to SD card


Insert SD card into Raspberry Pi


Power up Raspberry Pi and install the Raspbian distro


Click the wifi icon and connect to wireless


sudo apt-get update


sudo apt-get upgrade


Don't forget to change the default password!: 
passwd






Remove Wolfram Whatever




sudo apt-get purge wolfram-engine


sudo apt-get autoremove


sudo apt-get update


sudo apt-get upgrade






Enable SSH




ifconfig
 - retrieve IP address


sudo raspi-config


Interfacing Options
 > 
Enable SSH


Don't forget to change wifi password from default:
 
passwd






Enable Remote Desktop




sudo apt-get install tightvncserver


sudo apt-get install xrdp

docs.text:
Setup




Enable the camera via 
sudo raspi-config


reboot




Command line Usage


raspistill -o image.jpg


Python library Installation




sudo apt-get update


sudo apt-get install python-picamera




Usage


import picamera


Create an instance of the PiCamera class:
 


cam = picamera.PiCamera
 


Take a photo:


cam.capture('photo.jpg')
docs.title: Pi Camera

docs.text: Enable the camera via  sudo raspi-config  reboot
docs.title: Setup
